info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 30 at 4:52PM MDT until July 30 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Union County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 451 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Clayton Lake State Park, or 7 miles northwest of Clayton, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Clayton, Clayton Lake State Park and Seneca. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 418 and 429. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
